node.title: Urban Meyer fired by NFL's Jaguars after ultra-rocky, brief stay
node.description: He didn't even make it through his first season as Jacksonville's head coach. The latest flashpoint was a former Jags kicker accusing Meyer of kicking him during practice.
node.content: ["After dealing with multiple controversies, the Jacksonville Jaguars have finally had enough of Urban Meyer as their head coach. He was fired, in a move announced after midnight on Thursday morning.\u00a0", "The firing ends a tumultuous run for Meyer, who was mired in several controversies during his short time in Jacksonville.", "The move comes on the same day that former Jags kicker\u00a0Josh Lambo\u00a0said Meyer once kicked him during a team practice.\u00a0", "\"I'm in a lunge position. Left leg forward, right leg back,\" Lambo\u00a0told the Tampa Bay Times. \"While I'm in that stretch position, [Meyer] comes up to me and says, 'Hey Dips--t, make your f--king kicks!' And kicks me in the leg.\"", "Lambo said that he responded by telling Meyer \"Don't you ever f---ing kick me again\" and Meyer responded to that by saying, \"I'm the head ball coach. I'll kick you whenever the f--- I want.\"", "That incident seemed to be the last straw for Jaguars owner Shad Khan.", "As recently as Monday, Khan\u00a0had insinuated that Meyer\u00a0would likely make it through the season, but he clearly changed his mind at some point over the past 48 hours.\u00a0", "In a statement, Khan said he dumped Meyer because he felt that an immediate change was necessary.\u00a0", "\"After deliberation over many weeks and a thorough analysis of the entirety of Urban's tenure with our team, I am bitterly disappointed to arrive at the conclusion that an immediate change is imperative for everyone,\" Khan said. \"I informed Urban of the change this evening. As I stated in October, regaining our trust and respect was essential. Regrettably, it did not happen.\"", "As Khan noted, Meyer was already on thin ice due to his actions on October. After a Thursday night game in Cincinnati, Meyer decided to stay in Ohio instead of flying back to Florida with the team.", "During his time in the Buckeye state, Meyer spent some time at his restaurant in Columbus and while there, he was caught on video suggestively dancing with a\u00a0woman who wasn't his wife.\u00a0", "After the incident, Meyer apologized to the team, but even with that, it was still clear that Khan wasn't happy with him. Following the apology, Khan made it clear that Meyer would have to regain his trust.\u00a0", "\"I appreciate Urban's remorse, which I believe is sincere,\" Khan said in October. \"Now, he must regain our trust and respect. That will require a personal commitment from Urban to everyone who supports, represents or plays for our team. I am confident he will deliver.\"", "In the weeks that followed, things seemed to be getting better in Jacksonville with the Jaguars winning two of their next four games, but that hot streak didn't last long. The Jags are currently on a five-game losing streak that started in Week 10, and frustration seemed to boil over with every loss during the streak.\u00a0", "CBS Sports\u00a0NFL\u00a0Insider Jason La Canfora reported over the weekend that Meyer was having \"credibility issues with his players and staff.\" La Canfora also noted that, \"His relationships with players were never a strong suit and have deteriorated further since his scandal-filled bye weekend in Ohio.\"", "If the Jaguars were winning games or if the team was improving every week, this is stuff that Khan might have been able to overlook, but with Meyer seemingly involved in a new controversy every week, the Jags owner knew\u00a0 he couldn't ignore what was happening.\u00a0", "Not only did Meyer seem to be losing his players' respect, he wasn't helping the development of quarterback Trevor Lawrence, who was selected with the No. 1 overall pick in the 2021\u00a0NFL Draft. Even Lawrence and Meyer have been at odds at times, with the quarterback wondering why running back James Robinson got benched in a recent game.\u00a0", "With Meyer out, offensive coordinator Darrell Bevell will serve as interim head coach for the rest of the season.", "One upside for the Jaguars in firing Meyer now is that they'll be able to start their search for a new coach in the next few weeks.", "Under\u00a0an NFL rule that was just passed Wednesday, a team that fires its coach can start interviewing candidates once there are just two weeks left in the regular season, which means Jacksonville can start talking to potential replacements as soon as Dec. 28.\u00a0", "The next Jaguars coach will be the fifth that Khan has hired since purchasing the team in November 2011. Under his ownership, the Jags have only had one winning season in 10 full years. If you include interim coaches, the next one will be the seventh head coach under Khan's watch.\u00a0", "With his firing, Meyer joins a somewhat rare club of coaches who have been let go after one season or less on the job. Since 2000, there have been a total of 12 one-and-done coaches, including Meyer.", "The most recent coach to lose his job after one year was Arizona's Steve Wilks (2018). Before that, Chip Kelly (2016) and Jim Tomsula (2015) only lasted one year with the 49ers.\u00a0", "The Jaguars thought they were making a splash hire when they brought in the former Ohio State coach but instead, they got someone whose name was splashed all over the headlines every week.", "Meyer's tenure in Jacksonville ended after just 336 days on the job and with a 2-11 record.", "For Breaking News & Analysis Download the Free CBS News app"]
